x_symbol.description: xFenster takes an existing DIV or IFRAME element and dynamically encloses it in a draggable, resizeable "window" (fenster). If the DIV or IFRAME does not exist xFenster will create it. The constructor takes a single object as an argument. The properties of this object are documented below in the "Parameters" section.

par.name: clientId
par.note: Id string of client element (a DIV or IFRAME). If the element does not exist xFenster will create it. clientId also becomes the property name of a reference to this xFenster in the instances object. (string, no default, clientId is the only required property of xfArgs, the remainder are optional.)

par.name: title
par.note: Initial title for the title bar. (string, default="")

par.name: url
par.note: Initial URL to load into the IFRAME. If this is not a string it is assumed the client element is a DIV instead of an IFRAME. (string, default=undefined)

par.name: x, y
par.note: Initial position of fenster. (integer, default=0, 0)

par.name: w, h
par.note: Initial size of fenster. (integer, default=200, 200)

par.name: minW
par.note: Width when minimized. (integer, default=100)

par.name: conBor
par.note: Border size applied to container element. (integer, default=1)

par.name: conPad
par.note: Padding applied to container element. (integer, default=1)

par.name: cliBor
par.note: Border size applied to client element. (integer, default=0)

par.name: fenceId
par.note: Id string (or Element reference) of fence element. The fenster's move, resize, minimize and maximize will be limited to the boundary of the fence element. Only supported for absolute fensters. (string or object, default=undefined)

par.name: noFixed
par.note: If true (and for IE6 and down), the outer container is given position:absolute, else it is given position:fixed. (boolean, default=false)

par.name: noMove
par.note: If true, moving (dragging by the titlebar) is disabled, else it is enabled. (boolean, default=false)

par.name: noResize
par.note: If true, resizing (dragging by the lower-right corner) is disabled, else it is enabled. (boolean, default=false)

par.name: noMinimize
par.note: If true, the minimize button is disabled, else it is enabled. (boolean, default=false)

par.name: noMaximize
par.note: If true, the maximize button is disabled, else it is enabled. (boolean, default=false)

par.name: noClose
par.note: If true, the close button is disabled, else it is enabled. (boolean, default=false)

par.name: noStatus
par.note: If true, the status bar is disabled, else it is enabled. (boolean, default=false)

par.name: noMenu
par.note: If true, the control menu is disabled, else it is enabled. (boolean, default=true. if fnMenu is defined then noMenu defaults to false)

par.name: fnPaint
par.note: fnPaint(xf) - Called after a "paint". (function, default=undefined)

par.name: fnMove
par.note: fnMove(xf,x,y) - Called before xf is moved. x,y is target position of xf's outer container. Return true to allow move, false to cancel. (function, default=undefined)

par.name: fnResize
par.note: fnResize(xf,w,h) - Called before xf is resized. w,h is target size of client element. Return true to allow resize, false to cancel. (function, default=undefined)

par.name: fnDragEnd
par.note: fnDragEnd(xf) - Called at the end of a drag event for Move and Resize. (function, default=undefined)

par.name: fnMinimize
par.note: fnMinimize(xf) - Called before xf is minimized. Return true to allow minimize, false to cancel. (function, default=undefined)

par.name: fnMaximize
par.note: fnMaximize(xf, w, h) - Called before xf is maximized. w,h is target size of client element. Return true to allow maximize, false to cancel. (function, default=undefined)

par.name: fnRestore
par.note: fnRestore(xf) - Called after xf is restored. (function, default=undefined)

par.name: fnClose
par.note: fnClose(xf) - Called before xf is closed. Return true to allow close, false to cancel. (function, default=undefined)

par.name: fnFocus
par.note: fnFocus(xf) - Called before xf is focused. Return true to allow focus, false to cancel. (function, default=undefined)

par.name: fnLoad
par.note: fnLoad(xf) - Called when IFRAME finishes loading a page. (function, default=undefined)

par.name: fnMenu
par.note: fnMenu(xf) - Called before control menu is displayed. See demo 4 for usage. Return true to allow it, false to cancel. (function, default=undefined)

par.name: clsCon, clsCli, clsMsk, clsMnu
par.note: Class names for outer container, client, IFRAME mask and control menu elements. (string, default="xfContainer", "xfClient", "xfMask", "xfMenu")

par.name: clsTB, clsTBF
par.note: Class names for title bar default and focused states. (string, default="xfTBar", "xfTBarF")

par.name: clsSB, clsSBF
par.note: Class names for status bar default and focused states. (string, default="xfSBar", "xfSBarF")

par.name: clsRszI, clsMinI, clsMaxI, clsRstI, clsCloI, clsMnuI
par.note: Class names for resize, minimize, maximize, restore, close and control menu icons. (string, default="xfRszIco", "xfMinIco", "xfMaxIco", "xfRstIco", "xfCloIco", "xfMnuIco")

par.name: ttResize, ttMinimize, ttMaximize, ttRestore, ttClose, ttMenu
par.note: Text for icon tooltips. (string, default="Resize", "Minimize", "Maximize", "Restore", "Close", "")

prop.name: a
prop.note: A copy of the xfArgs object passed to the constructor. Defaults have been assigned to undefined properties.

prop.name: con
prop.note: The outermost container element. To resize the fenster, set a.w and a.h then call paint(0,0).

prop.name: cli
prop.note: The client element contains the fenster's "content". It is a DIV or IFRAME.

prop.name: mnu
prop.note: The control menu element. You must provide its contents in fnMenu. See demo 4 for example usage.

prop.name: min
prop.note: True if the fenster is minimized.

prop.name: max
prop.note: True if the fenster is maximized.

prop.name: hid
prop.note: True if the fenster is hidden (closed).

prop.name: ifr
prop.note: True if the client element is an IFRAME.

meth.name: paint(dw,dh)
meth.note: Resize the fenster and all its child elements. dw,dh is added to the outer container's current size.

meth.name: resize(w,h)
meth.note: Resize the fenster and all its child elements. The outer container is resized to w,h.

meth.name: focus()
meth.note: Bring the fenster to the top and highlight its title and status bars.

meth.name: href(url)
meth.note: Set or return the contained IFRAME's "location.href" property.

meth.name: hide()
meth.note: Set the fenster's container to "display:none" and focus the fenster that was previously focused. This method is called when the user clicks the "close" icon.

meth.name: show()
meth.note: Set the fenster's container to "display:block" and call the fenster's focus method.

meth.name: status(s)
meth.note: Set or return the fenster's statusbar innerHTML.

meth.name: title(s)
meth.note: Set or return the fenster's titlebar innerHTML.

meth.name: destroy()
meth.note: Remove the fenster from the DOM, remove all internal references to the fenster, and unregister all its event listeners. This method is automatically called on each fenster when the window unload event occurs.

meth.name: restore()
meth.note: Restore the fenster's pre-maximized or pre-minimized size and position.

comment.author: mf
comment.note: A fenster's move/resize/minimize/maximize is restricted to the boundary of its co-ordinate system. Its position and/or size is adjusted when the window is resized. There are three different co-ordinate systems: [code] 1. Fixed - The boundary is defined by the viewport. 2. Absolute with a fence - The boundary is defined by the position and size of the fence element. 3. Absolute with no fence - The boundary's width is defined by the viewport and its height is defined by the document. [/code] xFenster "static" properties: [code] - "xFenster.instances" is an object. When an xFenster is created a property is added to the object which references that xFenster object. The name of the property is the same as the clientId. So you do not have to maintain your own references to instances. - "xFenster.minimized" is an array of all minimized fensters. - "xFenster.nextZ" is the next z-index used to focus a fenster. - "xFenster.focused" is the currently focused fenster. [/code] xFenster "static" methods: [code] - xFenster.all() - xFenster.showAll() - xFenster.hideAll() - xFenster.paintAll() - xFenster.restoreAll() - xFenster.minimizeAll() - xFenster.maximizeAll() - xFenster.mask(on,xf) - xFenster.getBounds(xf) - xFenster.fitToBounds(xf) - xFenster.fitMinToBounds(xf) - xFenster.inBounds(xf,dx,dy,dw,dh) [/code] TODO and Misc. Notes [code] - Much of the code assumes all fensters have the same boundary. This may or may not be a problem - depends on your application. - fitToBounds works well but only makes fensters smaller, not larger. This seems unintuitive. - Should maximized fensters cover, or not cover, any minimized fensters? Currently they do. Perhaps the top of the first minimized fenster should be considered the bottom of the boundary? - Tile and cascade could be implemented but there are many implications to consider. [/code]
